#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Kurashiki
#Text=Kurashiki ( 倉敷 ) is one of Japan 's great old merchant towns , with around half a million citizens today .
#Text=Sitting along a scenic canal at the foot of Mt . Tsurugata , Kurashiki 's white-walled storehouses are beautifully preserved and open for exploration .
#Text=Understand
#Text=During the Edo period , Kurashiki did heavy trade with the capital in rice , sugar , and other goods .
#Text=Later , during the Meiji Restoration ( i.e. after 1868 ) , the city became known for textiles .

#Text=Kurashiki escaped World War II largely unscathed , and as a result , many of the original storehouses , mills , and shops remain in beautiful condition , open to visitors in the Bikan Historic Area .
#Text=The effect is delightful — storehouses ( 倉 kura ) with lattice windows share space with weeping willows along the banks of the old canal , which is illuminated at night .
#Text=The canal has led some overly optimistic tourist associations to call Kurashiki " the Venice of Japan " .

#Text=If not that — the city surrounding the Bikan area is as much a concrete jumble as any other in the country — Kurashiki is still a rare piece of old Japan , one that gives a sense of where people lived and worked , not merely the temples at which they worshipped .
#Text=Tourist information
#Text=JR Kurashiki Station , ☏ +81 86-424-1220 .
#Text=Exit the train station to the south ( left from JR ticket collection ) , overlooking the bus depot .
#Text=Stay on the upper level , and you 'll find the office among the shops to the right ( west ) .
#Text=Bikan Historic Area , 1-4-8 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-422-0542 .
#Text=JR Shin-Kurashiki Station , ☏ +81 86-526-8446 .
#Text=By plane
#Text=A shuttle bus will take you from the Okayama airport to JR Kurashiki Station in approximately 45 minutes ( ¥ 1130 ) .
#Text=Tickets can be purchased from a vending machine outside of the airport .
#Text=Large luggage is okay ; the driver will stow it underneath the seats .
#Text=Staff at the information booth just beyond baggage claim are very helpful , and will go outside with you to purchase the ticket and get you on the appropriate bus .
#Text=Connections can also be made with the Hiroshima airport , via shuttle bus to Okayama ( 2 hours , ¥ 2100 ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=Kurashiki is on the San'yo Main Line between Okayama and Fukuyama .
#Text=The best way to reach Kurashiki from the San'yo Shinkansen is to transfer to a local train at Okayama ; the ride takes about 15 minutes ( ¥ 320 ) .
#Text=The few express trains between Okayama and Kurashiki are more than twice as expensive , and will only save you a couple of minutes .

#Text=However , if you have a Japan Rail Pass , you can take either a local or a limited express ; on the latter , hop onto any non-reserved car and simply flash your rail pass to the conductor , declaring Kurashiki as your destination .
#Text=The Shinkansen stops at Shin-Kurashiki Station ( 新倉敷 ) , another 10 minutes down the San'yo Main Line , but only with the all-stops Kodama trains .
#Text=It 's about 10 minutes on the local train from JR Kurashiki Station to Shin-Kurashiki Station .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Several companies run daytime and overnight bus routes from Tokyo , Osaka , Kobe , Matsuyama , Tokushima , Kochi , Fukuoka , and elsewhere .
#Text=Operators include Chugoku JR Bus Company ( +81 86-236-1123 ) .
#Text=Buses arrive and depart outside the north exit of JR Kurashiki Station .
#Text=Get around

#Text=Most of the sights in Kurashiki are in and around the Bikan area , which is easily reached on foot from the south exit of JR Kurashiki Station — about a ten-minute walk down Chuo-dori or the Ebisu-dori covered arcade .
#Text=Bikan Historic Area
#Text=Even if you 're not interested in the subject of a certain museum , the chance to explore inside these old warehouses and mills might be worth the price of admission .
#Text=Virtually all of the museums ( and many of the stores ) are closed on Mondays , which does at least mean fewer crowds and photo hounds competing for that perfect shot at the foot of a bridge .
#Text=For a terrific view of the entire Bikan area , head up the granite stairs on Mt . Tsurugata to the Achi Shrine , and have a wander around the park at the top .
#Text=Ohara Museum of Art ( 大原美術館 , ōhara bijutsukan ) , 1-1-15 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-422-0005 .
#Text=Tu - Su 09:00-17:00. Houses a deservedly renowned collection of classic European and American art , including major works by Picasso , Renoir , Monet , Matisse , and many others .
#Text=There 's another building for exhibitions by modern Japanese artists , which tend to be very good .

#Text=Set aside some time to wander the grounds as well , with Rodin statues out front , a small sculpture garden out back , and neoclassical columns beatifically out of character with the rest of the area . ¥
#Text=1300 adults ( includes Kojima Torajiro Memorial Hall admission ) .
#Text=English audio guide for main hall ¥ 500 .
#Text=Kojima Torajiro Memorial Hall ( 児島虎次郎記念館 ) , 7-1 Hon-machi ( Ivy Square ) , ☏ +81 86-422-0005 .
#Text=Tu - Su 09:00-17:00. Dedicated to the work of the Japanese artist who directed the acquisition of most of the Ohara Museum 's collection .
#Text=¥ 1300 adults ( includes Ohara Museum admission ) .
#Text=Archaeological Museum ( 倉敷考古館 ) , 1-3-13 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-422-1542 .
#Text=W - Su 09:00-17:00. Housed in a particularly lovely old rice warehouse , this museum has Japanese , Chinese , and even Incan artifacts on display .
#Text=¥ 400 adults , ¥ 250 students .
#Text=Japan Rural Toy Museum ( 日本郷土玩具館 ) , 1-4-16 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-422-8058 .
#Text=Tu - Su 09:00-17:00. Has a collection of over 40,000 toys , although only 5,000 or so are generally on display .
#Text=Most are show-pieces ( and occasionally eerie ones at that ) , but there are some that kids can play with hands-on .
#Text=¥ 300 adults , ¥ 200 teenagers , ¥ 100 kids .
#Text=Museum of Folkcraft ( 倉敷民藝館 ) , 1-4-11 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-422-1637 .
#Text=Tu - Su 09:00 - 17:00 ( Dec-Feb to 16:15 ) .
#Text=Hosts excellent seasonal and permanent exhibitions of Japanese folk crafts .
#Text=Even if you 're not captivated by the subject matter , the space in which it 's housed — three vintage structures connected by narrow corridors and old stairwells — is worth checking out .
#Text=¥ 700 adults , ¥ 400 students .
#Text=Senichi Hoshino Museum ( 星野仙一記念館 , hoshino sen'ichi kinenkan ) , 1-10-11 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-430-0001 .

#Text=Apr-Sep : 09:30 - 18:00 , Oct-Mar : 09:30-17:00. Kurashiki native Sen'ichi Hoshino was a long-time pitcher and manager for the Chunichi Dragons of Japanese pro baseball ; now , as manager and director of the Hanshin Tigers , his open hatred of the Yomiuri Giants has renewed focus .
#Text=This recently-opened museum collects some of his memorabilia and career highlights .
#Text=Adults ¥ 500 , students ¥ 200 .
#Text=Shogi Master Oyama Memorial Museum ( 大山名人記念館 ) , 1-18-1 Chuo-dori , ☏ +81 86-434-0003 .

#Text=Yasuharu Oyama ( 1923-1992 ) , also a Kurashiki native , was an eighteen time world champion of shogi ; upon his retirement , he was crowned the 15th Lifetime Meijin ( Grand Master ) of the game .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Momotaro Museum ( 桃太郎のからくり博物館 ) , 5-11 Hon-machi , ☏ +81 86-423-2008 .

column3: 桃太郎のからくり博物館

column1: #Text=Tu - Su 10:00-17:00. With the figure of Momotaro outside and souvenirs sold inside , it is often mistaken by foreign tourists as just another shop and a cute photo-op , but this building is actually a " museum of mystery " dedicated to Momotaro , the Peach Boy .
#Text=The museum features a variety of fun and interactive mind tricks that bear no real connection to the tale but are quite fun , especially for children .

#Text=From there , prepare yourself for a walk through the dark lair of the ogres that Momotaro defeated before ascending the stairs to see some historical depictions of the tale and other items of nostalgia .
#Text=Adults ¥ 600 , young students ¥ 400 , children ¥ 100 .
#Text=Yumiko Igarashi Museum ( いがらしゆみこ美術館 ) , 9-3 Hon-machi , ☏ +81 86-426-1919 .

column3: いがらしゆみこ美術館

column1: #Text=Memorabilia and artwork from Candy Candy , one of the most popular manga among Japanese girls and a cult favorite overseas .
#Text=( There is , however , no actual candy here . )
#Text=¥ 600 adults , ¥ 400 students .
